acAtm.name: acAtm

revisions.description: Addition new table - remote gateway into the mib

acAtm.contactinfo: Postal: Support AudioCodes LTD 1 Hayarden Street Airport City Lod, ISRAEL 70151 Tel: 972-3-9764000 Fax: 972-3-9764040 Email: support@audiocodes.com Web: www.audiocodes.com

atmGeneralParamsAtmDefaultApplicationTyp.name: atmGeneralParamsAtmDefaultApplicationType
atmGeneralParamsAtmDefaultApplicationTyp.description: This is the default application type used when the board cannot determine from the H248 add message which AAL type to use.

atmGeneralParamsAtmTransmissionMode.name: atmGeneralParamsAtmTransmissionMode
atmGeneralParamsAtmTransmissionMode.description: This is the ATM Port Optical Carrier type which indicates whether the European standard (SDH) is to be employed or the North American Standard (SONET)

atmPortTable.name: atmPortTable
atmPortTable.description: This table indicates general information about and alarm status of the ATM optical fiber ports. It is also used to configure the ATM address associated with the optical port and read that address.

atmPortAdministrativeState.name: atmPortAdministrativeState
atmPortAdministrativeState.description: This is the ATM Port Administrative State

atmPortOperationalState.name: atmPortOperationalState
atmPortOperationalState.description: This is the Port Operational State

atmPortNumber.name: atmPortNumber
atmPortNumber.description: This is the ATM Port Number

atmPortAdminAddress.name: atmPortAdminAddress
atmPortAdminAddress.description: This is the AdministrativeATM Port Address (20 octets in length - 40 hexadecimal characters). This address is manually configured.This address is used when ILMI is not available.

atmPortOperationalAddress.name: atmPortOperationalAddress
atmPortOperationalAddress.description: This is the port ATM address currently in operation (i.e.:assigned to this port). This addressis set to atmPortAdminAddress if no ILMI address is registered. If an ILMI address is successfully registered, then atmPortOperationalAddress will be set to the ILMI one, though an administrative address may have already been configured. Thus ILMI address always takes precedence over the administrative one. If both the administrative and ILMI addresses are unavailable then the operational address is left empty. Refer to atmPortAddressMode for which address is operational.

atmPortAlarmStatus.name: atmPortAlarmStatus
atmPortAlarmStatus.description: This is the ATM Port Alarm Status. The possible values are: cleared(0) - LOS, AIS and RDI conditions are not present los(1) - the LOS condition is present ais(2) - AIS condition is present (LOS condition is not present) rdi(4) - RDI condition is present (LOS and AIS conditions are not present) Note: Alarm conditions (from the SONET/SDH standard documents) are: LOS - Loss Of Signal AIS - Alarm Indication Signal RDI - Remote Defect Indication

atmPortAddressMode.name: atmPortAddressMode
atmPortAddressMode.description: The mode reflects the type of address in operation. addrModeNone(0) : No administrative address has been configured and no ILMI address has been registered. Thus no address is available to assign to the port. addrModeManual(1): An Administrative address has been configured and no ILMI address has been registered. Thus the port is assigned the manually configured address.addrModeILMI (2): An ILMI address has been registered. The port is assigned this address. The administrative address is ignored if it has been configured.

atmRemoteGatewayTable.name: atmRemoteGatewayTable
atmRemoteGatewayTable.description: This includes the destination remote Gateways (and RNC) that the Media Gateway would have signaling contact with.

atmRemoteGatewayRowStatus.name: atmRemoteGatewayRowStatus
atmRemoteGatewayRowStatus.description: The RowStatus textual convention is used to manage the creation and deletion and active of conceptual rows.

atmRemoteGatewayNSAPAddress.name: atmRemoteGatewayNSAPAddress
atmRemoteGatewayNSAPAddress.description: This is the ATM Address associated with the remote Gateway to which this PVC connects (20 octets in length - 40 hexadecimal characters)

atmRemoteGatewayALCAPInstanceNum.name: atmRemoteGatewayALCAPInstanceNum
atmRemoteGatewayALCAPInstanceNum.description: ALCAP Instance number associated with the remote Gateway ( 3G only)

aal2PVCTable.name: aal2PVCTable
aal2PVCTable.description: This table contains information referring to Permanent Virtual Channels connecting the AMS to the ATM Edge Switch.

aal2PVCRowStatus.name: aal2PVCRowStatus
aal2PVCRowStatus.description: The RowStatus textual convention is used to manage the creation and deletion and active of conceptual rows.

aal2PVCRemoteGatewayIndex.name: aal2PVCRemoteGatewayIndex
aal2PVCRemoteGatewayIndex.description: This is the gw index that associated with the remote Gateway table to which this PVC connects (20 octets in length - 40 hexadecimal characters)

aal2PVCVCCIPATHID.name: aal2PVCVCCIPATHID
aal2PVCVCCIPATHID.description: This is the range of Virtual Connection Channel Identifiers which is an end to end identifier for an AAL2 VC.

aal2PVCPortNumber.name: aal2PVCPortNumber
aal2PVCPortNumber.description: This is the port number associated with the PVC

aal2PVCVpi.name: aal2PVCVpi
aal2PVCVpi.description: This is the VPI assigned to the PVC

aal2PVCVci.name: aal2PVCVci
aal2PVCVci.description: This is the VCI assigned to the PVC

aal2PVCMaxNumOfCid.name: aal2PVCMaxNumOfCid
aal2PVCMaxNumOfCid.description: This is the maximum number of CIDs for the AAL2 PVC.

aal2PVCNumOfCidInUse.name: aal2PVCNumOfCidInUse
aal2PVCNumOfCidInUse.description: This is the number of CIDs for AAL2 PVC currently in use.

aal2PVCServiceCategory.name: aal2PVCServiceCategory
aal2PVCServiceCategory.description: This is the Service Category which is either CBR (Constant Bit Rate) or rtVBR (realtime Variable Bit Rate)

aal2PVCPCR.name: aal2PVCPCR
aal2PVCPCR.description: This is the peak cell rate (PCR) associated with the provisioned virtual channel (PVC). Includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the PVC

aal2PVCSCR.name: aal2PVCSCR
aal2PVCSCR.description: This is the sustained cell rate (SCR) associated with the provisioned virtual channel (PVC). Includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the PVC.

aal2PVCMBS.name: aal2PVCMBS
aal2PVCMBS.description: This is the Maximum Burst Size (MBS) for the provisioned virtual channel (PVC).

atmPortLoopbackConfigTable.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigTable
atmPortLoopbackConfigTable.description: This table gives the Loopback Configuration associated with a given Optical Fiber Port number.

atmPortLoopbackConfigIsUsed.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigIsUsed
atmPortLoopbackConfigIsUsed.description: This tells whether or not the port loopback is used. If the port is available on the board, this is yes.

atmPortLoopbackConfigPortNumber.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigPortNumber
atmPortLoopbackConfigPortNumber.description: The port number associated with the optical port which is being described.

atmPortLoopbackConfigMode.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigMode
atmPortLoopbackConfigMode.description: This is the mode in which the loopback will work: no loopback, UNI loopback, or Virtual Path loopback

atmPortLoopbackConfigOutBoundVirtualPath.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigOutBoundVirtualPath
atmPortLoopbackConfigOutBoundVirtualPath.description: If the atmLoopback mode is VP, this specifies the VP identity for the cells going toward the ATM edge switch

atmPortLoopbackConfigInBoundVirtualPath.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigInBoundVirtualPath
atmPortLoopbackConfigInBoundVirtualPath.description: If the atmLoopback mode is VP, this specifies the VP identity for the cells coming from the ATM edge switch

atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeFirst.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeFirst
atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeFirst.description: If the atmLoopback mode is VP, this specifies the minimum VCI within the inbound and outbound VP which may be used.

atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeLast.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeLast
atmPortLoopbackConfigVciRangeLast.description: If the atmLoopback mode is VP, this specifies the maximum VCI within the inbound and outbound VP which may be used.

atmPortLoopbackConfigServiceCategory.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigServiceCategory
atmPortLoopbackConfigServiceCategory.description: This category is limited to Constant Bit Rate (CBR) traffic or realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) for this release.

atmPortLoopbackConfigPCR.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigPCR
atmPortLoopbackConfigPCR.description: This is the peak cell rate (PCR) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used for Constant Bit Rate (CBR) traffic. For AAL2, this includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the SVC. For AAL1, there is only one channel per SVC (and no concept of a CID).

atmPortLoopbackConfigSCR.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigSCR
atmPortLoopbackConfigSCR.description: This is the sustained cell rate (SCR) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used for realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) traffice. For AAL2, this includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the SVC. For AAL1, there is only one channel per SVC (and no concept of a CID).

atmPortLoopbackConfigMBS.name: atmPortLoopbackConfigMBS
atmPortLoopbackConfigMBS.description: This is the Maximum Burst Size (MBS) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used in realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) traffice. The unit for this parameter is ATM cells.

atmSvcProfileTable.name: atmSvcProfileTable
atmSvcProfileTable.description: This table indicates information about profiles associated with the creation of each new AAL2 SVC.

atmSvcProfileIsUsed.name: atmSvcProfileIsUsed
atmSvcProfileIsUsed.description: This tells whether or not this SVC profile is used. If it is used, the value is yes.

atmSvcProfileIndex.name: atmSvcProfileIndex
atmSvcProfileIndex.description: Initially only one SVC Profile is supported. This parameter may be updated later as the table supports more profiles

atmSvcProfileMaxNumOfCids.name: atmSvcProfileMaxNumOfCids
atmSvcProfileMaxNumOfCids.description: The CIDs fall in the range of 8 to 255, so there are a maximum of 248 CIDs possible. The assignment of CID #8 may be received but not initiated. Assignments from the low end of the CID range should start with 9 as there are some vendors who use 8 for a special OAM purpose.

atmSvcProfilePCR.name: atmSvcProfilePCR
atmSvcProfilePCR.description: This is the peak cell rate (PCR) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used for Constant Bit Rate (CBR) traffic. For AAL2, this includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the SVC. For AAL1, there is only one channel per SVC (and no concept of a CID).

atmSvcProfileSCR.name: atmSvcProfileSCR
atmSvcProfileSCR.description: This is the sustained cell rate (SCR) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used for realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) traffice. For AAL2, this includes bandwidth for all CIDs within the SVC. For AAL1, there is only one channel per SVC (and no concept of a CID).

atmSvcProfileMBS.name: atmSvcProfileMBS
atmSvcProfileMBS.description: This is the Maximum Burst Size (MBS) associated with the switched virtual channel (SVC). This is used in realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) traffice. The unit for this parameter is ATM cells.

atmSvcProfilePersistence.name: atmSvcProfilePersistence
atmSvcProfilePersistence.description: This is the parameter which descirbes how long an AAL2 SVC will persist even when no CIDs are in use. Generally, this is on the order of 180 to 600 seconds. Non-persistent SVCs should have a value of 0.

atmSvcProfileServiceCategory.name: atmSvcProfileServiceCategory
atmSvcProfileServiceCategory.description: This category is limited to Constant Bit Rate (CBR) traffic or realtime Variable Bit Rate (rtVBR) for this release.

atmSvcConnectionTable.name: atmSvcConnectionTable
atmSvcConnectionTable.description: This is the table which describes the read only characteristics of a given AAL1 or AAL2 SVC.

atmSvcConnectionIndex.name: atmSvcConnectionIndex
atmSvcConnectionIndex.description: A unique index, that identifies the SVC on the system.

atmSvcConnectionRemoteGatewayAddress.name: atmSvcConnectionRemoteGatewayAddress
atmSvcConnectionRemoteGatewayAddress.description: This is the ATM Address associated with the remote Gateway to which this SVC connects (20 octets in length - 40 hexadecimal characters)

atmSvcConnectionPort.name: atmSvcConnectionPort
atmSvcConnectionPort.description: This is the port on which the SVC is connected

atmSvcConnectionVpi.name: atmSvcConnectionVpi
atmSvcConnectionVpi.description: This is the VPI associated with the SVC

atmSvcConnectionVci.name: atmSvcConnectionVci
atmSvcConnectionVci.description: This is the VCI associated with the SVC

atmSvcConnectionAALType.name: atmSvcConnectionAALType
atmSvcConnectionAALType.description: This is the Adaptation Layer type. It is either AAL1 or AAL2.

atmSvcConnectionDirection.name: atmSvcConnectionDirection
atmSvcConnectionDirection.description: This is the direction in which the SVC was setup. Incoming means the this end received the SETUP. Outgoing means this end sent the SETUP.

atmSvcConnectionEecid.name: atmSvcConnectionEecid
atmSvcConnectionEecid.description: This is the unique end to end identifier associated with the setup of AAL1 SVCs

atmSvcConnectionVcci.name: atmSvcConnectionVcci
atmSvcConnectionVcci.description: This is the unique identity of an SVC associated with an AAL2 connection

atmSvcConnectionMaxNumOfCid.name: atmSvcConnectionMaxNumOfCid
atmSvcConnectionMaxNumOfCid.description: This is the maximum number of CIDs for an AAL2 SVC.

atmSvcConnectionNumOfCidInUse.name: atmSvcConnectionNumOfCidInUse
atmSvcConnectionNumOfCidInUse.description: This is the number of channel Ids currently in use in a given SVC.
